author: frangio_
content: <@425274498732916736> would you support option 2.2.2 or 2.2.3 in [this post](https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/evm-immediates/25605)?

author: chfast
content: Definitely 2.2.3 over 2.2.2. I have slightly preference for longer opocdes (2.2.3) over the current spec. But I'd need to implement this to check how big overhead the decoding is...

author: chfast
content: Good part about 2.2.3 is that this gives general guidance how to extend opcodes with immediates...

author: frangio_
content: do you mean the overhead of decoding in current 8024? it should be very low right? it's all very simple arithmetic

author: chfast
content: Sure, but still more than just reading a byte.

author: frangio_
content: main downside of 2.2.3 imo is the bytecode size overhead

author: chfast
content: Anyway, I'm not opposed to the EIP, but still having multiple spec options is not ideal.
